These programs offer borrowers the opportunity to have their student loan debt forgiven or repaid in exchange for work in specific fields or professions. Over 50 such programs are authorized, with around 30 operational as of October 1, 2017. Loan forgiveness and repayment programs are created by the federal government to forgive or repay a portion of an individual's student loan debt in exchange for meeting certain requirements, such as working in public service or specific occupations. These programs aim to provide financial incentives for individuals to enter or remain in these fields.
